content.match_overview: Arsenal enter this fixture 2nd in the Premier League (68pts) with Bournemouth 10th (50pts). The Gunners boast the league's 2nd-best home record (10W-6D-1L) while Bournemouth rank 7th in away form (6W-7D-4L). Arsenal are winless in 3 league matches but come off a 4-0 thrashing of Ipswich, while Bournemouth drew 1-1 with Manchester United last weekend. Historically, Arsenal have won all 7 Premier League home games against Bournemouth by an aggregate score of 19-2[1][6][14].

team_news.raw: Arsenal miss Gabriel Magalhaes (hamstring surgery), Gabriel Jesus (ACL), and Riccardo Calafiori (knee). Ben White remains a doubt with muscle fatigue. Bournemouth are without Enes Unal (knee) and Ryan Christie (groin surgery)[8][9][11][13].

home.projected_xi: Raya; White, Saliba, Kiwior, Zinchenko; Partey, Rice; Sterling, Nwaneri, Trossard; Merino

away.projected_xi: Arrizabalaga; Smith, Zabarnyi, Huijsen, Kerkez; Adams, Scott; Semenyo, Kluivert, Ouattara; Evanilson

asian_handicap_analysis.analysis: Arsenal's -0.25 Asian Handicap at 1.86 offers value given their 62.5% win probability per simulations[14]. Despite defensive absences, their home xG of 1.92/90 and Bournemouth's away xGA of 1.60/90 suggests Arsenal can cover[1][3]. However, Bournemouth's 76% BTTS rate away tempers confidence[3].
asian_handicap_analysis.raw: The line accounts for Arsenal's European fatigue but underestimates their home supremacy. 7 of Bournemouth's last 10 away games saw them lose by 1+ goal[3], while Arsenal have won 4 of last 5 home matches by 2+ goals[1].

key_player_matchups.title: Leandro Trossard vs Adam Smith
key_player_matchups.content: Trossard's 0.45 xG/90 faces Smith's 1.3 tackles/90. Smith's 1.7 fouls/90 could lead to set-piece opportunities[1][3].
key_player_matchups.raw: Trossard has created 4 big chances in last 5 home games. Smith has been dribbled past 1.8x/90 away[3].

key_player_matchups.title: Declan Rice vs Alex Scott
key_player_matchups.content: Rice's 2.3 tackles/90 could neutralize Scott's 1.5 key passes/90. Scott's 83% pass accuracy vulnerable to Rice's pressing[1][3].
key_player_matchups.raw: Scott loses possession 12x/90 in away games. Rice averages 6.7 ball recoveries/90 at home[1][3].

key_player_matchups.title: William Saliba vs Evanilson
key_player_matchups.content: Saliba's 92% tackle success rate faces Evanilson's 0.42 xG/90. Aerial duel (Saliba 68% vs Evanilson 42%) crucial[1][3].
key_player_matchups.raw: Evanilson scores 71% of goals in open play. Saliba allows only 0.3 dribbles past/90 at home[1][3].

betting_insights.insight: 62.5% model probability vs 53.8% implied probability at 1.86 odds
betting_insights.raw: Value exists as bookmakers price Arsenal's chances lower than simulation models suggest[14].

betting_insights.insight: 65% of Arsenal's home games surpass 2.5 goals vs Bournemouth's 76% away[1][3]
betting_insights.raw: Combined 3.12 historical match average with both teams' xG totaling 3.41[4][6].

betting_insights.insight: 56% Arsenal home BTTS vs 76% Bournemouth away BTTS[1][3]
betting_insights.raw: Arsenal's defensive absences (Gabriel out) and Bournemouth's 1.88 away goals/90 create value[3][9].

prediction.reasoning: Arsenal's home dominance (59% win rate) and Bournemouth's defensive vulnerabilities (1.60 away xGA) suggest a narrow victory. However, European fatigue and Gabriel's absence allow Bournemouth to score[1][3][14].

content.my_say: As the Emirates braces for its penultimate league curtain call, this clash pits a wounded giant against plucky overachievers. Arteta's men, their title dreams dusted by Liverpool's triumph, now walk a tightrope between continental glory and domestic duty. Across the technical area, Iraola's Bournemouth arrive as modern-day alchemists - turning mid-table mediocrity into European contention through tactical sorcery. Watch for Zinchenko's inverted wand-work against Semenyo's rapid counter-curse, while Saliba's defensive shield faces its sternest test from Evanilson's Brazilian jogo bonito. In this game of thrones between North London aristocracy and Dorset upstarts, three points could crown Bournemouth's fairy tale or salvage Arsenal's pride. The xG ghosts of fixtures past whisper 2-1 to the hosts, but football's scriptwriters love an underdog subplot...

content.raw_perplexity_content:
<think>
Okay, let's tackle this betting analysis for Arsenal vs Bournemouth. First, I need to gather all the relevant data from the provided search results and structure it according to the user's requirements.

Starting with the match overview. Arsenal are 2nd in the league with 68 points, while Bournemouth are 10th with 50 points. Arsenal's home form is excellent, with 10 wins, 6 draws, and 1 loss. Bournemouth's away form is decent, 6 wins, 7 draws, 4 losses. Recent form: Arsenal drew with Crystal Palace and beat Ipswich, while Bournemouth drew with Man United and Crystal Palace. Head-to-head, Arsenal have won the last seven home games against Bournemouth. That's a strong point for Arsenal's dominance at home.

Next, Asian Handicap analysis. The line is -0.25 for Arsenal at 1.86 odds. From the search results, BetMGM mentions Arsenal as -0.5 favorites but the user-provided line is -0.25. The model from Dimers.com gives Arsenal a 62.5% chance, which translates to implied odds around 1.60. The bookmaker's 1.86 offers value here. Also, Bournemouth's high BTTS rate (76% away) and Arsenal's defensive injuries might make the handicap tricky. But Arsenal's xG is higher, so maybe value on Arsenal -0.25.

Key player matchups: Trossard vs Adam Smith. Trossard has high xG, and Smith's defensive stats might struggle. Rice vs Scott in midfield. Rice's defensive stats could disrupt Scott's creativity. Saliba vs Evanilson. Saliba's strong defensive numbers against Evanilson's goal contribution.

Team news: Arsenal's injuries include Gabriel, Jesus, Calafiori, Jorginho. Bournemouth missing Unal and Christie. Using the provided lineups, Arsenal's defense is weakened but still solid with Saliba and Kiwior. Bournemouth's lineup has Kerkez and Zabarnyi, but their defense might be vulnerable.

Betting insights: 
1. Asian Handicap Arsenal -0.25 at 1.86. Model suggests 62.5% chance (1.60 odds), so value.
2. Over 2.5 goals. Bournemouth's away games average 3.41 goals, Arsenal's home games 2.82. Combined, high chance for over.
3. Both Teams to Score. Bournemouth's 76% away BTTS and Arsenal's defensive injuries support this.

Prediction: Arsenal 2-1. They have the edge at home but Bournemouth's attack can exploit defensive absences.

My Say: Highlight Arsenal's title disappointment and focus on Champions League, Bournemouth's fight for Conference League. Mention the tactical battles and key players. Make it engaging with a narrative about Arsenal's resilience and Bournemouth's underdog spirit.

Check all citations against the search results to ensure accuracy. Use the provided sources for stats, injuries, and predictions. Make sure each fact is backed by a source index. Avoid any markdown and follow JSON structure strictly.
